alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated more slowly moving thunderstorms over central Broward County will move slowly south into the advisory area during the next hour. These thunderstorms will be capable of producing rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches on top of the already 2 to 3 inches that has fallen from the earlier thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect through 7 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Miami Gardens, Miami Lakes, Opa- Locka, Country Club, Palm Springs North, Miramar Parkway And University Drive and Saint Thomas University. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
